qas.question: When can Min Nan texts be dated back to?
What is an example of the Min Nan Texts?

answers.text: Doctrina Christiana en letra y lengua china

qas.question: What year was Doctrina Christiana en letra y lengua china written?
Who wrote Doctrina Christiana en letra y lengua china?
What is the name of the earliest Southern Min colloquial text?
Who has developed an alphabet based on Pumindian?

plausible_answers.text: a dictionary called the Minnan Fangyan-Putonghua Cidian (閩南方言普通話詞典)

qas.question: Where has the alphabet based on the Ming Dynasty script been published?

plausible_answers.text: the Doctrina Christiana en letra y lengua china

qas.question: What is an example of the Pumindian texts?

plausible_answers.text: the Spanish Dominicans in the Philippines

qas.question: When was the play Minnan Fangyan-Putonghua Cidian written?

context: Min Nan texts, all Hokkien, can be dated back to <a0_0>the 16th century<a0_0/>. One example is <b7_0>the <a1_0>Doctrina Christiana en letra y lengua china<b7_0/><a1_0/>, presumably written <a2_0>after 1587<a2_0/> by <b8_0>the <a3_0>Spanish Dominicans in the Philippines<b8_0/><a3_0/>. Another is a Ming Dynasty script of a play called <a4_0>Romance of the Lychee Mirror<a4_0/> (<b9_0>1566<b9_0/>), supposedly the earliest Southern Min colloquial text. <b5_0>Xiamen University<b5_0/> has also developed an alphabet based on Pinyin, which has been published in <b6_0>a dictionary called the Minnan Fangyan-Putonghua Cidian (閩南方言普通話詞典)<b6_0/> and a language teaching book, which is used to teach the language to foreigners and Chinese non-speakers. It is known as Pumindian.
